intro: Lotononis argentea, commonly known as silver lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lotononis argentea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
